page.title: 03FARMING YEAR STREETLY HALL.
page.content: In autumn the plough comes along and turns over and breaks up the soil for the seeds.Then the power harrow breaks it up into smaller bits.Next comes the drill which blows seeds down pipes. It then sows 64 seeds all at once which then go into the soil. Here are the names of a few of the crops sown in autumn. Winter barley. winter wheat, oil seed rape and sugar beet. The fertilizer is a special wide armed sprayer and sprays its liquid all over the seeds to encourage growth.In spring they spray for disease to kill all the pests that lay their eggs on the crops. Some corn is sown in spring this is called spring wheat and spring barley(which grows during the summer) This is the last to be harvested. Every 3rd or 4th year they grow a different crop from the year before. This is called a break crop.
